full_text: Page 1709 Re: Draft language From Ray Ormond To Hugh Hurwitz Date 2019/08/12 06:01 Subject: Re: Draft language Attachments: TEXT.htm Will do. Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone ------- Original message ------- From: Hugh Hurwitz [redacted]@bop.gov Date: 8/12/19 5:31 AM (GMT-05:00) To: Ray Ormond [redacted]@bop.gov Subject: Fwd: Draft language >>> "Hugh Hurwitz" 08/12/2019 05:31 >>> In addition to details on those two staff, please pull total staffing info, number vacancies, AWOL, long term leave, etc. Also, status of curr Hugh Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone ------- Original message ------- From: [redacted] (OAG)" [redacted]@usdoj.gov Date: 8/11/19 11:12 PM (GMT-05:00) To: Hugh Hurwitz [redacted]@bop.gov Cc: Ray Ormond [redacted]@bop.gov Subject: RE: Draft language >>> "[redacted] (OAG)" 08/11/2019 23:12 >>> Thanks. This is helpful. We can talk tomorrow about the timing. It will also be helpful to get some information about staffing at MCC I've seen additional press reports trying to link the staffing shortages, overtime and Thanks, [redacted] From: Hugh Hurwitz [redacted]@bop.gov Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2019 9:53 PM To: [redacted] (OAG) [redacted]@jmd.usdoj.gov Cc: Ray Ormond [redacted]@bop.gov Subject: Draft language [redacted] as discussed, several options are below. Please note that we should discuss timing of all this. I will need to ensure staff are notified first, and I shoul [redacted] Hugh Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone Page 8781 DOJ-OGR-00025752

additional_notes: The document is an email chain with redactions. The content appears to be related to staffing information and draft language. The emails are sent from Samsung Galaxy smartphones using Verizon.
